conclusion: Determine the velocity of ions after velocity selector and charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected by magnetic analyzer.
In the velocity selector, electric and magnetic fields are perpendicular.
Electric force must balance magnetic force for ions to pass through velocity selector: qE = qvB.
Solving for velocity v in velocity selector gives v = E/B.
In the magnetic analyzer, ions move in a circular path under magnetic field.
Radius of circular path in magnetic analyzer is R = mv/qB.
Substitute v = E/B into radius equation gives R = mE/qB^2.
Radius R must allow ions to pass through apertures at ends of quarter-circular ring.
For small angles, use geometry to find R = (R1 + R2)/2.
Substitute R into radius equation gives q/m = 4E/B^2(R1 + R2).
Final velocity of ions after velocity selector is v = E/B.
Final charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected by magnetic analyzer is q/m = 4E/B^2(R1 + R2).
